{{Infobox person | name = Amr Waked | image = Amr Waked.jpg | caption = | alt = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1972|08|02}} | birth_place = [[Cairo]], [[Egypt]] | occupation = Actor | Important roles = ashaba wala buisness
ibraheem labyad
tito
[[syriana]] | years present = 1990 - present }} '''Amr Waked''' ([[Arabic]]: Ø¹ÙØ±Ù ÙØ§ÙØ¯; born August 2, 1972) is an [[Egyptians|Egyptian]] [[film actor|film]], [[television actor|television]], and [[stage actor]], known for his roles portraying [[Middle Eastern]] and [[Mediterranean]] characters. He is best known to international audiences and in [[Hollywood]] as the [[terrorist]] leader in the 2005 film ''[[Syriana]]'' (2005). He also played the role of Rafik in [[Steven Soderbergh]]'s movie ''[[Contagion (film)|Contagion]]''. ==Background== Waked was born on August 7, 1972. He is a graduate of the [[American University in Cairo]], and has performed in theater from 1992 through 2002. He originally just [[moonlighting|moonlighted]] as an actor, and relied on his day job as a [[stock trader]], before finally dedicating himself to a career as an actor. Waked joined the [[2011 Egyptian revolution|2011 Egypt anti-government protests]]. ==Career== Waked's first major role was in ''Ashab wala business'' (2001), for which reviewer's offered that he portrayed the role of "Gehad " so well that many viewers left the theater believing he was actually a [[Palestine|Palestinian]] actor, rather than Egyptian. His first lead role was as Ahmed in ''Deil el Samaka'' (The Fish's tail) (2003), and in 2005 he worked alongside [[George Clooney]] in the film ''[[Syriana]]'', for which in 2006 he won a 'Special Award for Arabs in The International Cinema' at the [[Cairo International Film Festival]]. Waked joined the cast of the Egyptian [[television series]] [http://www.lahazat-harega.com "Lahazat Harega" ''"Critical Moments"''] in 2007, shooting 32 episodes for season one. In 2008, Waked joined the cast of the [[BBC]]/[[HBO]] [[television series]] ''[[House of Saddam]]'' to portray [[Saddam Hussein]]'s son-in-law [[Hussein Kamel]]. Since the lead role of Saddam Hussein was played by [[Israel]]i actor [[Yigal Naor]], Waked faced punishment by Egypt's Actors Union which opposes normalization of ties with Israel. The union threatened banning him from all future projects in Egypt. In 2009 he was invited co-host of the 33rd Cairo International Film Festival, and in 2010 he rejoined the cast of ''Lahazat Harega''. === Filmography === * ''Lilly'' (1991) * ''Gannat Al Shayateen'' (2000) -- AKA "The Paradise of Fallen Angels" * ''Ashab Walla Business'' (2001) -- AKA "Friends or Business" * ''Min Nazret Ain'' (2003) -- AKA "At First Sight" * ''Dail Al Samakah'' (2003) -- AKA "The Fish Tail" * ''Sahar Al Layaly'' (2003) -- AKA "Sleepless Nights" (Voice) * ''Ahla Al Awqat'' (2004) -- AKA "Best Times" * ''Khalty Faransa'' (2004) -- AKA "Auntie Faransa" * ''[[Tito (film)|Tito]]'' (2004) * ''Seeb Wana Aseeb'' (2004) -- AKA "You Let Go, Then I Let Go" * ''Dam Al Ghazal'' (2005) -- AKA "The Gazelle's Blood" * ''[[Syriana]]'' (2005) * ''Kalam Fel Hob'' (2006) -- AKA "Talk About Love" * ''Elaqat Khassa'' (2006) -- AKA "Private Relations" * ''Genenet Al Asmak'' (2008) -- AKA "The Aquarium" * ''Ibrahim Al Abyad'' (2009) * ''[[The Traveller (2009 film)|Al Mosafer]]'' (2009) -- AKA "The Traveler" * ''Il Padre E Lo Straniero'' (2010) -- AKA (The Father and the Stranger) * ''Alf Leila We Leila'' (2010) -- AKA (One Thousand and One Nights) *''[[Contagion (film)|Contagion]]'' (2011) *''[[Salmon Fishing in the Yemen]]'' (2012) ''[post production]'' === Television === * [http://www.lahazat-harega.com "Lahazat Harega" ''"Critical Moments, Season One"''] (32+ episodes, 2007) * ''[[House of Saddam]]'' (3 episodes, 2008) * ''[[The Shooting of Thomas Hurndall]]'' (2008) * [http://www.lahazat-harega.com "Lahazat Harega" ''"Critical Moments, Season Two"''] (32+ episodes, 2010) * ''[[Abwab el khoof]]'' (2011) ===Theater=== * 1992, ''Afareet Hamza We Fatma'' as Hamza * 1992, ''Vinegar Tom'' as The Devil * 1993, ''Crimes Of The Heart'' as Doc * 1993, ''Al Ghaba Al Saeeda'' as The Fox * 1994, ''Tales From Agabad'' as Hero * 1994, ''Compass Berserk'' as Montigu * 1994, ''The Bus'' as Ahmed * 1995, ''Oedipus The President'' as Prometheus * 2000, ''Al Ze'ab Yohaddid Al Madinah'' as The Journalist * 2002, ''Shabab Rewish Tahn'' as Ahmed ==Recognition== ===Awards & nominations=== * 1999, won 'Film Writers and Critics Special Award' at [[Alexandria International Film Festival]] * 1999, won 'Best Supporting Actor' award at [[Alexandria International Film Festival]] for ''Gannat al shayateen'' * 2003, won 'Best Actor' award at [[Alexandria International Film Festival]] for ''Dail el samakah'' * 2006, won 'Special Award for Arabs in The International Cinema' at [[Cairo International Film Festival]] for ''[[Syriana]]'' * 2006, won 'Horus Award' for 'Best Supporting Actor' at Cairo National Festival for Egyptian Cinema for ''Dam el ghazal'' * 2010, won 'Best Supporting Actor' at Dear Guest Festival for ''Ibrahim Labyad'' * 2010, won "Best Actor for Second Role" at Cairo National Festival for Egyptian Cinema for ''Ibrahim Labyad'' ==References== {{reflist|refs= {{cite
